185960724.review:
One of the best games based on the Prequel Star Wars timeline.
You get to play as the elite of the Grand Army of the Republic: The clone Commandos
The squad based mechanics are really well done for the standards of the time:
-Commanding them to heal
-Formation changes, call-ups
-Setting them on sniping/heavy/grenade positions
Also, this game is based a lot on the teamwork between the squad members and the munition management. You're flesh and blood and not even the normal battle droids give you an easy time, let alone the Geonosian flyers and the Super Battle Droids.. the enemy packs a punch, and you have to learn which is the best strategy to deal with each one.
The arsenal at your disposal is unique and fun to use, the main weapon taking the form of assault, sniper and grenade launcher.
The game ends sadly in a cliffhanger, with a sequel that never got released to this day.. but a game like this one is exactly what the Star Wars community would always enjoy!

Also I found 0 technical issues, no crashes, glitches etc. It will run on a toaster. If you can´t put up with the old graphics i believe there is a HD Texture Mod.

Alors il y a des petits défauts comme le gameplay et le système pour gérer son escouade qui reste très basique, mais aussi les chargements en plein milieu du niveau qui sort un peu du jeu.

Une dernière chose : Le jeu est vachement dur quand même, il y a des ennemis qui sont juste des sacs à PV, surtout qu'on les rencontres souvent.

184909320.review:
[h1] A 20 year old game somehow is one of the best Star Wars game to play in 2025 [/h1]

Gameplay: 8/10
Story: 9/10
Game Design: 8/10
Music: 10/10
Overall: 8.5/10

How does a 20-year-old game like Star Wars: Republic Commando hold up in 2025? To my amazement, it plays pretty well! First off, the music - just phenomenal. With access to virtually any Star Wars song, they've crafted an auditory experience that perfectly complements the militaristic vibe of the game. The opening sequence? Absolutely perfect, setting the tone for what's to come.

For 2005, it's surprisingly reminiscent of what Half-Life did for the genre, you actually feel like you're part of the war-torn galaxy of the Clone Wars.

However, gameplay does have its caveats. After a while, it can feel a bit monotonous. The missions start to blend together, and the squad commands, while innovative for the time, can feel clunky by today's standards. But, if you're a Star Wars fan, these are minor gripes. The game truly captures the essence of the clone troopers' life, making you feel like part of the squad. The graphics, while dated, have a charm to them. They don't detract from the experience but rather add to the nostalgia for these older type of games.

If you love Star Wars, you'll find plenty to enjoy here. It throws you back into the world of the prequels from a unique and cool angle; and it really shows how well some games age. I got the game for $1 off G2A, definitely worth revisiting or experiencing for the first time if you missed it back in the day.

184661025.review:
I've played and completed this game before on the Nintendo Switch a long time ago, it is an amazing, immersive first-person experience that is a must have for any Clone Trooper enjoyer like myself. Each member of Delta Squad feels alive, with their own charming personalities that make you feel connected to them all. Some moments in the game's missions are quite tense, as you only have a limited time to complete a task, making you need to think more about your actions during that time. The game is also quite short, which some may dislike, only having three levels that each take about an hour or two to complete, but it is still an overall amazing game.

The only issue I have with the PC version is the mouse sensitivity in the menus, being very high and from what I know, unfixable. It can be gotten used to after a while though.

In my opinion it is an overall 9/10. A sequel with modern graphics that would continue the story of Delta Squad would be amazing and I just wish they'd make it already!

In eigentlich keinem anderen Starwars spiel fühlt man sich so in die Welt eingetaucht wie bei Republic Comando.

2: I find it incredible how long it is, I put 9 hours of play into it and I still have to finish it.

3: I can't imagine this game if they made a remake.

184442690.review:
+++ Fantastic music
++ Great levels, interesting stories
++ Great characters
+ Fun squad-management
+ Interesting extras

-- Outdated combat

This game is a cult classic and with a few QoL-Improvements still worth playing in 2025! (It's pretty cheap as well!) https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3173072602
My favourite thing is the soundtrack: many tracks are directly from the movies. The insane part is that this games' original music can EASILY compete with one of the best movie scores ever made. During the game you visit 3 locations, which are visually distinct and have interesting, short stories around them. There are also partially different enemies and weapons per level. The characters are great and your squadmates have a lot of character, the ensuing banter between them is entertaining as well. Managing your squad and focusing enemies is pretty fun.

Unfortunately that does not apply to the combat: Firstly, enemies are very spongey, so you need to focus them down. Shooting a super battle droid on full-auto for 20 seconds still feels too much. In later levels the game SPAMS those enemies, too. Secondly, the melee has no range at all, I had to almost stand inside the enemies to even hit them. Hilariously the mini-knife is the strongest weapon in the game and does insane damage... Thirdly, the pace is pretty slow in general. It's supposed to be a more tactical game, I get it. But invisible walls everywhere, which don't allow me to jump over the SMALLEST of covers is pretty annoying. Lastly, the permanently respawning enemies are a gigantic pain in the ass, and I am not talking about the droid dispensers. Getting swarmed on Geonosis by spongey, infinitely respawning enemies was an awful affair!

The fact this game is now over 20 years old and Starts up and runs with little drama is amazing. This game is from a time when Star Wars was good and the setting was a bit darker and had more edge to it. Republic Commando is a game where you play as the clone commando 38 and even on the worst/darkest parts of the game your squad will still make quips about killing droids and aliens alike. If you have never played this game before just buy it. The game is cheap there are mods if you want better graphics and the story and characters are great. 

Republic Commando is a Classic 8/10 game
